definition: to go by a roundabout route/to take a detour/(medicine or civil engineering) bypass
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
gastric bypass

sentences.english: Most entrepreneurs skirt close to it.
sentences.chinese: 大多數企業家會繞道而行。
所以我們只好繞道而行。

sentences.english: Appears I had a humour bypass this week.
sentences.chinese: 看來這周我的幽默繞道而行了。

sentences.english: The heavy rain made us stray.
sentences.chinese: 滂沱大雨迫使我們繞道而行。

sentences.english: We drove home by a  roundabout route.
Follow me. Trouble you please bypass.
sentences.chinese: 跟我套近乎旳麻煩你請繞道。

sentences.english: The boat fetched about round Cape Horn.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船繞道經過合恩角。

sentences.english: Because of the construction, we must take a detour.
sentences.chinese: 因施工，我們必須繞道而行。

sentences.english: On the way you decide to take a detour to say hi to a friend.
sentences.chinese: 路上你決定繞道拜訪一位朋友。

sentences.english: The taxi didn't go by the direct route, but in a roundabout way.
sentences.chinese: 出租車沒有走直路，而是繞道行駛。
他們繞道拐上33號高速公路。

sentences.english: Many began to avoid the king's highway out of fear of the man -eater.
sentences.chinese: 很多人害怕被老虎食掉，紛紛繞道而行。

sentences.english: Dear brothers and sisters, you may be in the midst of a detour.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的弟兄姐妹們，你或許也正在繞道而行。

sentences.english: No photos, feel bad from your heart please away from the window fast and furious.
sentences.chinese: 沒有照片，心存不良的無聊人士請速速繞道而行。

sentences.english: We had to make a detour round the floods.
sentences.chinese: 我們爲了避開洪水得繞道而行。

sentences.english: They said we'd take a detour route in order cross the Haihe River Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 不過他們都說要繞道海河大橋。

definition: to avoid/to evade/to keep away from
itinerary/route/political line (e.g. right revisionist road)/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
on the way
repeatedly/time and again
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
gents washroom/gents toilets
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
to make a detour/to take the long route
to drive a car
to chase to kill
to drop in/to visit/to lock a door/(of a shop) to close/to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
openly and without fear/brazenly
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
father's elder brother's wife/aunt (affectionate term for an elderly woman)
inconvenient/troublesome/annoying/to trouble or bother sb/to put sb to trouble
